intro: Hertia ciliata, commonly known as the silver leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its narrow, silvery-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care. Hertia ciliata prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
